      Action associateAction(java.lang.String controllerName, net.java.games.input.Component.Identifier component, Action action, InputManager.INPUT_ACTION_TYPE actionType)
      associateAction() causes the IInputManager object to associate an IAction (for example, "walk forward", "fire weapon", etc) with the activation of a specific component of a specific controller.

      void update(float time)
      update(float time) instructs the IInputManager object to update its notion of the state of all input devices about which it knows, and then to invoke any IActions associated with device components based on the IInputManager.INPUT_ACTION_TYPE of the IAction.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(float time)
        Description copied from interface: InputManager
        update(float time) instructs the IInputManager object to update its notion of the state of all input devices about which it knows, and then to invoke any IActions associated with device components based on the IInputManager.INPUT_ACTION_TYPE of the IAction.
        Specified by:
        update in interface InputManager
        Parameters:
        time - - the amount of time, normally given in milliseconds, which has passed since the last call to update().

      • associateAction

        public Action associateAction(java.lang.String controllerName,
                              net.java.games.input.Component.Identifier component,
                              Action action,
                              InputManager.INPUT_ACTION_TYPE actionType)
        Description copied from interface: InputManager
        associateAction() causes the IInputManager object to associate an IAction (for example, "walk forward", "fire weapon", etc) with the activation of a specific component of a specific controller. Associating an IAction with a controller and component causes IInputManager#update(float) to automatically invoke that IAction, by calling its IAction#performAction(float,Event) method, based on the associated IInputManager.INPUT_ACTION_TYPE (for example, each time the specified component on the specified controller changes state).
        Specified by:
        associateAction in interface InputManager
        Parameters:
        controllerName - - the name of the controller, as returned by Controller.getName() with which the action is to be associated
        component - - identifier of the component with which the action is to be associated
        action - - the action which is to be associated with the specified component
        actionType - -- indicates when the action is to be invoked in relation to the occurrence of component events
        Returns:
        the action which was previously associated with the specified component, or null if there was no previously associated action.

      • associateAction

        public Action associateAction(net.java.games.input.Controller controller,
                              net.java.games.input.Component.Identifier component,
                              Action action,
                              InputManager.INPUT_ACTION_TYPE actionType)
        Specified by:

      • getKeyboardName

        public java.lang.String getKeyboardName()
        Returns the name string for the Keyboard controller (if more than one keyboard is present, the first one is returned). If no keyboard controller is found, null is returned.
        Specified by:
        getKeyboardName in interface InputManager

      • getMouseName

        public java.lang.String getMouseName()

        Specified by:
        getMouseName in interface InputManager

      • getKeyboardController

        public net.java.games.input.Controller getKeyboardController(int n)
        Returns the nth occurrence of a keyboard Controller. If no keyboard controller is found, null is returned.
        Specified by:
        getKeyboardController in interface InputManager
        Parameters:
        n - Occurrence number, such as 1 for first occurrence of a keyboard, or 2 for second occurrence of a keyboard.

      • getKeyboardControllerWithNComponents

        public net.java.games.input.Controller getKeyboardControllerWithNComponents(int n)
        Returns the first keyboard controller with n or more components. If no such keyboard controller is found, null is returned.
        Specified by:
        getKeyboardControllerWithNComponents in interface InputManager
        Parameters:
        n - The minimum number of components the keyboard should have.
